content.text: A manual database records data on a physical medium (e.g., a book). An electronic database stores data on an electronic medium (e.g., computer).

comparison.title: Manual Database
features: Difficult to analyse (Hard to process data).
Should present in order of input (Fixed data input).
Difficult to delete unnecessary data (Hard to delete).
Difficult to update data (Hard to update).
More storage space (Large space needed to store data).
More man power required (More effort required).

comparison.title: Electronic Database
features: Easy to obtain copies (Easy to copy data).
Data analysis can be carried out efficiently.
Data can be shared (Data can be shared).
Independence of data (Data and software are independent).

terms.def: A collection of objects. E.g., Fields.
A collection of records is called a data table.
A collection of related tables is called a relational database.

types_of_relationships.name: One-to-one
types_of_relationships.def: If only a row of a table is related to a row of another table, it is called a one-to-one relationship. Two tables exist, A and B.
types_of_relationships.details: One row in Table A is related to one row in Table B, and a row in Table B is related to one row in Table A.

data_types.numeric: Integer (Plus or minus whole numeric figures)
data_types.text: Composed of letters, numbers or special characters. E.g., National Identity Card.
data_types.currency: Used to indicate monetary values. E.g., $12.45, Rs. 35.00
data_types.date_time: Indicates dates and time. E.g., 12/23/2013, 7.35 a.m
data_types.boolean: There are only two boolean (logical) values: True and False.

content.description: A column (or a combination of columns) which enables to identify a record uniquely is called a primary key. The primary key of a table is underlined to identify as unique.

special_attributes: Should not be empty (data being there is mandatory)
No duplicate values (same values do not exist)

special_attributes.title: Primary Key in Book Table
special_attributes.scenario: Price of a book is same. Multiple books may have the same price (e.g., 300.00, 300.00).

special_attributes.title: Composite Primary Key
special_attributes.composite_key_def: The combination of Year and Sport is suitable for the primary key in this table.

content.definition: If a field (or a combination of fields) of one table can be used to identify rows of another table, these field(s) are called foreign keys.

relationships.connection: The Admission Number is the primary key of the Student Table and it is the foreign key of the Marks Table.
relationships.flow_diagram: An arrow is drawn from the foreign key to the primary key to indicate the relationship.

types_of_relationships.name: One-to-many
types_of_relationships.def: If each record of a table is related to several records of another table, it is called a one-to-many relationship. (Table A is related table B. A record in Table A can be related to several records in Table B. A record in Table B can be related to only one record in Table A. There can be no records in Table B not related to records in Table A.

types_of_relationships.name: Many-to-many
types_of_relationships.def: If a record of a table is related to several records of another table, and a record of that related table is related to several records of other tables, there is a many-to-many relationship between those two tables.

content.definition: The primary key which consists of two or more columns of a table uniquely identifies a record is called a composite primary key.

example.composite_key_def: The composite primary key of this table = Year + Sport

content.title: Summary
content: A database is defined as a collection of organized data.
In a table a column is known as a ‘Field’.
A raw of a table is known as a ‘Record’
Advantages of electronic database: Efficient in searching data, Easy to obtain copies, Smaller storage, Efficient analysis, Data sharing, Independence of data.
Characteristics: Avoid data redundancy, Consistency of data, Increased efficiency, Increased accuracy, Increased validity, Increased security.
A column or collection of columns in a table when records can be identified uniquely is called primary key.
If a field (or a combination of fields) of one table can be used to identify rows in another table, these fields are called foreign keys.
Data redundancy means same data is stored in several database tables.

Data redundancy leads to difficulties: Inability to select a primary key field to maintain identity of records (no unique field), Inability to analyze data properly (cannot find total), Reduced efficiency (entering same data repeatedly takes more time), Possibility to get inaccurate data (errors in entering data), Difficult to input data (entering details for each record), Possibility to make errors in deleting data (deleting one record deletes related records), Difficult to update data (updating requires attention to each record).
